questions.text: A car travels 240 km in 4 hours. What is its speed?
questions.explanation:
Given: Distance = 240 km, Time = 4 hours

Speed = Distance / Time
Speed = 240 / 4
Speed = 60 km/h

Therefore, the speed of the car is 60 km/h.

To convert km/h to m/s, multiply by 5/18

Speed in m/s = 54 × (5/18)
Speed in m/s = (54 × 5) / 18
Speed in m/s = 270 / 18
Speed in m/s = 15 m/s

Therefore, 54 km/h = 15 m/s.

questions.text: A person walks at 5 km/h and covers a certain distance in 3 hours. If he walks at 6 km/h, how much time will he take to cover the same distance?
questions.explanation:
Given: Speed₁ = 5 km/h, Time₁ = 3 hours, Speed₂ = 6 km/h

Step 1: Find the distance
Distance = Speed × Time = 5 × 3 = 15 km

Step 2: Find time at new speed
Time₂ = Distance / Speed₂
Time₂ = 15 / 6
Time₂ = 2.5 hours

Therefore, at 6 km/h, he will take 2.5 hours.

questions.text: A car travels from A to B at 40 km/h and returns from B to A at 60 km/h. What is the average speed for the entire journey?
questions.explanation:
When same distance is covered at two different speeds, average speed is the harmonic mean:

Average Speed = (2 × s₁ × s₂) / (s₁ + s₂)

Average Speed = (2 × 40 × 60) / (40 + 60)
Average Speed = 4800 / 100
Average Speed = 48 km/h

Note: Average is NOT (40+60)/2 = 50 km/h!

Therefore, the average speed is 48 km/h.

questions.text: Two trains are moving in opposite directions at speeds of 45 km/h and 35 km/h. If they are 200 km apart, after how much time will they meet?
questions.explanation:
Given: Speed₁ = 45 km/h, Speed₂ = 35 km/h, Distance = 200 km
Moving in opposite directions

Relative Speed = Speed₁ + Speed₂
Relative Speed = 45 + 35 = 80 km/h

Time to meet = Distance / Relative Speed
Time = 200 / 80
Time = 2.5 hours

Therefore, they will meet after 2.5 hours.

questions.text: A train 120 m long passes a pole in 12 seconds. What is the speed of the train in km/h?
questions.explanation:
Given: Length of train = 120 m, Time = 12 seconds

When train crosses a pole, distance = length of train

Speed = Distance / Time
Speed = 120 / 12 = 10 m/s

Convert to km/h: multiply by 18/5
Speed = 10 × (18/5) = 36 km/h

Therefore, the speed of the train is 36 km/h.

questions.text: A train 150 m long crosses a 250 m long platform in 20 seconds. What is the speed of the train in m/s?
questions.explanation:
Given: Length of train = 150 m, Length of platform = 250 m, Time = 20 seconds

Total distance = Length of train + Length of platform
Total distance = 150 + 250 = 400 m

Speed = Distance / Time
Speed = 400 / 20
Speed = 20 m/s

Therefore, the speed of the train is 20 m/s.

questions.text: Two trains of lengths 100 m and 150 m are moving in opposite directions at 54 km/h and 72 km/h respectively. How long will they take to cross each other?
questions.explanation:
Given: Length₁ = 100 m, Length₂ = 150 m, Speed₁ = 54 km/h, Speed₂ = 72 km/h
Moving in opposite directions

Step 1: Find total distance
Total distance = 100 + 150 = 250 m

Step 2: Find relative speed
Relative speed = 54 + 72 = 126 km/h

Convert to m/s: 126 × (5/18) = 35 m/s

Step 3: Find time
Time = Distance / Speed
Time = 250 / 35
Time = 50/7 ≈ 7.14 seconds ≈ 7 seconds

Therefore, they will take approximately 7 seconds to cross each other.

questions.text: A boat covers 30 km downstream in 3 hours and 20 km upstream in 4 hours. What is the speed of the boat in still water?
questions.explanation:
Given: Downstream = 30 km in 3 hours, Upstream = 20 km in 4 hours

Step 1: Find downstream and upstream speeds
Downstream speed = 30 / 3 = 10 km/h
Upstream speed = 20 / 4 = 5 km/h

Step 2: Find boat speed in still water
Boat speed = (Downstream speed + Upstream speed) / 2
Boat speed = (10 + 5) / 2
Boat speed = 15 / 2
Boat speed = 7.5 km/h

Therefore, the speed of the boat in still water is 7.5 km/h.

questions.text: The speed of a boat in still water is 12 km/h and the speed of the stream is 3 km/h. What is the downstream speed?
questions.explanation:
Given: Boat speed in still water = 12 km/h, Stream speed = 3 km/h

Downstream speed = Boat speed + Stream speed
Downstream speed = 12 + 3
Downstream speed = 15 km/h

Note: When moving downstream, the stream helps, so speeds add up.

Therefore, the downstream speed is 15 km/h.

questions.text: A man travels 120 km at 60 km/h and then 180 km at 90 km/h. What is his average speed for the entire journey?
questions.explanation:
Given: Distance₁ = 120 km at 60 km/h, Distance₂ = 180 km at 90 km/h

Step 1: Find total distance
Total distance = 120 + 180 = 300 km

Step 2: Find time for each part
Time₁ = 120 / 60 = 2 hours
Time₂ = 180 / 90 = 2 hours

Step 3: Find total time
Total time = 2 + 2 = 4 hours

Step 4: Find average speed
Average speed = Total distance / Total time
Average speed = 300 / 4
Average speed = 75 km/h

Therefore, the average speed is 75 km/h.

questions.text: A person covers half the distance at 40 km/h and the remaining half at 60 km/h. What is the average speed?
questions.explanation:
When the same distance is covered at two different speeds:

Average Speed = (2 × s₁ × s₂) / (s₁ + s₂)

Average Speed = (2 × 40 × 60) / (40 + 60)
Average Speed = 4800 / 100
Average Speed = 48 km/h

Note: This is the harmonic mean, not the arithmetic mean!
Arithmetic mean would be (40+60)/2 = 50 km/h, which is incorrect.

Therefore, the average speed is 48 km/h.

questions.text: Two cars start from the same point and move in the same direction at speeds of 50 km/h and 40 km/h. After how much time will they be 30 km apart?
questions.explanation:
Given: Speed₁ = 50 km/h, Speed₂ = 40 km/h, Distance apart = 30 km
Moving in same direction

Relative Speed = Speed₁ - Speed₂
Relative Speed = 50 - 40 = 10 km/h

Time = Distance / Relative Speed
Time = 30 / 10
Time = 3 hours

Therefore, they will be 30 km apart after 3 hours.

questions.text: A train traveling at 72 km/h crosses a man walking in the opposite direction at 8 km/h in 9 seconds. What is the length of the train?
questions.explanation:
Given: Train speed = 72 km/h, Man speed = 8 km/h (opposite), Time = 9 seconds

Step 1: Find relative speed
Since moving in opposite directions:
Relative speed = 72 + 8 = 80 km/h

Step 2: Convert to m/s
Relative speed = 80 × (5/18) = 400/18 = 200/9 m/s

Step 3: Find length of train
Length = Speed × Time
Length = (200/9) × 9
Length = 200 m

Therefore, the length of the train is 200 m.

questions.text: A boat takes 4 hours to travel 36 km downstream and 6 hours to travel 30 km upstream. What is the speed of the stream?
questions.explanation:
Given: Downstream = 36 km in 4 hours, Upstream = 30 km in 6 hours

Step 1: Find downstream and upstream speeds
Downstream speed = 36 / 4 = 9 km/h
Upstream speed = 30 / 6 = 5 km/h

Step 2: Find stream speed
Stream speed = (Downstream speed - Upstream speed) / 2
Stream speed = (9 - 5) / 2
Stream speed = 4 / 2
Stream speed = 2 km/h

Verification:
Boat speed = (9 + 5) / 2 = 7 km/h
Downstream = 7 + 2 = 9 km/h ✓
Upstream = 7 - 2 = 5 km/h ✓

Therefore, the speed of the stream is 2 km/h.

questions.text: Two trains of equal length are running on parallel tracks in the same direction at 60 km/h and 48 km/h. The faster train passes the slower train in 36 seconds. What is the length of each train?
questions.explanation:
Given: Speed₁ = 60 km/h, Speed₂ = 48 km/h (same direction), Time = 36 seconds

Step 1: Find relative speed
Relative speed = 60 - 48 = 12 km/h

Step 2: Convert to m/s
Relative speed = 12 × (5/18) = 60/18 = 10/3 m/s

Step 3: Find total distance (sum of lengths)
Distance = Speed × Time
Distance = (10/3) × 36 = 120 m

Step 4: Length of each train
Since both trains are of equal length:
Length of each = 120 / 2 = 60 m

Therefore, the length of each train is 60 m.

questions.text: A person walks at 4 km/h for 2 hours, then at 5 km/h for 3 hours. What is the average speed?
questions.explanation:
Given: Speed₁ = 4 km/h for 2 hours, Speed₂ = 5 km/h for 3 hours

Step 1: Find distance covered in each part
Distance₁ = 4 × 2 = 8 km
Distance₂ = 5 × 3 = 15 km

Step 2: Find total distance and time
Total distance = 8 + 15 = 23 km
Total time = 2 + 3 = 5 hours

Step 3: Find average speed
Average speed = Total distance / Total time
Average speed = 23 / 5
Average speed = 4.6 km/h

Therefore, the average speed is 4.6 km/h.

questions.text: Two runners A and B run on a circular track of 400 m. A runs at 5 m/s and B at 3 m/s. If they start from the same point in the same direction, after how much time will they meet again?
questions.explanation:
Given: Track length = 400 m, Speed_A = 5 m/s, Speed_B = 3 m/s
Starting from same point, same direction

For circular track, same point, same direction:
Time to meet = Track length / (Difference of speeds)

Relative speed = 5 - 3 = 2 m/s

Time = 400 / 2 = 200 seconds

In this time:
A covers = 5 × 200 = 1000 m = 2.5 rounds
B covers = 3 × 200 = 600 m = 1.5 rounds
Difference = 1 round (400 m) ✓

Therefore, they will meet again after 200 seconds.
